topic_metadata.title: How to add a space in formula?

posts.name: Ruslan
posts.cooked:
Such a simple question, and I can’t find answer to it.

Using a backslash introduces a new line, instead of a space
posts.raw:
Such  a simple question, and I can't find answer to it.

Using  a backslash introduces a new line, instead of a space

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
Hi, thanks for your question! I have moved it to the Questions category ;)

There are a couple of kinds of space available, they are listed here: General Symbols – Typst Documentation

As the page says:

For example, #sym.arrow produces the → symbol. Within formulas, these symbols can be used without the #sym. prefix.

That means you could e.g. write

$ a quad b $
posts.raw:
Hi, thanks for your question! I have moved it to the #questions category ;)

There are a couple of kinds of space available, they are listed here: https://typst.app/docs/reference/symbols/sym/?query=space

As the page says:
> For example, `#sym.arrow` produces the → symbol. Within [formulas](https://typst.app/docs/reference/math/), these symbols can be used without the `#sym.` prefix.

That means you could e.g. write
```typ
$ a quad b $
```

posts.name: Kevio
posts.cooked: Instead of editing the title with [ANSWERED], it’d be nicer if you could just mark @SillyFreak’s answer as the solution :)
posts.raw: Instead of editing the title with `[ANSWERED]`, it'd be nicer if you could just mark @SillyFreak's answer as the solution :)
